alert.note: Alert for Shannon (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 16 at 7:38PM CST until February 18 at 9:00AM CST by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Missouri... Jacks Fork at Alley Spring affecting Shannon County. For the Jacks Fork River Basin...including Alley Spring...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY EVENING TO LATE FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Jacks Fork at Alley Spring. * WHEN...From Thursday evening to late Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, water impacts Alley Spring Campground. Water is one foot in depth at the 600, 800 and 900 loop camp sites. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:30 PM CST Wednesday the stage was 2.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tomorrow evening to a crest of 9.5 feet early Friday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Friday morning. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.6 feet on 04/28/2011. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday evening at 745 PM CST.
